clusters.title: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan
clusters.neutral_headline: Earthquake Hits Afghanistan, Following Previous Tremor

items.title: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan
items.standfirst: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.
items.content: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

items.title: Powerful earthquake shakes northern Afghanistan months after deadly quakes
items.standfirst: T he quake struck in the middle of the night at a depth of 28 kilometres.
items.content: A powerful 6.3-magnitude earthquake has shaken northern Afghanistan, according to the US Geological Survey.There were no immediate reports of major damage, though some photos on social media showed some rubble on roads and streets.The quake's epicentre was located 22 kilometres west-southwest of Khulm, Afghanistan, and had a depth of 28 kilometres.READ MORE: 'Heroic' staffer fighting for his life after saving people in UK train stabbingIt struck at 12.59 am on Monday local time, the USGS said.A similar magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck on August 31, 2025 in eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border killed more than 2200 people.On October 7, 2023, a magnitude 6.3 followed by strong aftershocks that left at least 4000 people dead, according to the Taliban government.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck northern Afghanistan.
The quake occurred two months after a deadly tremor.
The previous earthquake killed over 2,200 people.
The recent quake struck at a depth of 28 kilometers.
The number of casualties from the recent quake is unclear.

items.title: 'A champion becomes a legend': Makybe Diva's 'impossible' third Cup win
items.standfirst: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.
items.content: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.

ai_summary: Makybe Diva, an English filly, achieved an unprecedented third Melbourne Cup win.
The victory occurred twenty years ago, changing Australian racing history.
The horse's success began with humble beginnings in Australia.
Makybe Diva's win was considered an "impossible" feat.
The race marked a significant moment in Australian sporting history.

clusters.title: Constant power denied to 65,000 customers forced to pay upfront or disconnect
clusters.neutral_headline: Prepaid Power Customers Face Disconnections, Financial Hardship

items.title: Constant power denied to 65,000 customers forced to pay upfront or disconnect
items.standfirst: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.
items.content: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.

ai_summary: Approximately 65,000 customers with prepaid meters face power disconnections.
Disconnections occur frequently, especially during periods of extreme heat.
Customers must pay upfront to restore power after disconnection.
Disconnections lead to food spoilage and lack of air conditioning.
Customers endure long walks to reconnect their power supply.

clusters.title: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k
clusters.neutral_headline: Football Clubs Face Scrutiny Over Poker Machine Revenue
bullet_summary: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year

items.title: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k
items.standfirst: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.
items.content: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

ai_summary: Football-owned poker machines generate over $300,000 daily.
Football clubs and leagues lost over $110 million last financial year.
Calls are increasing for football teams to distance from poker machines.
Data reveals significant financial losses at football-owned venues.
The issue raises concerns about the relationship between football and gambling.
